This 1970 film tells the story of Pearl Harbor from a unique perspective, with plenty of action and suspense to keep you on the edge of your seat. Plus, it's got an all-star cast, including James Whitmore and Martin Balsam.

If that doesn't quite strike your fancy, I'd also recommend "The White Countess". This 2005 film is a beautifully shot romance set in 1930s Shanghai, with stunning performances from Natasha Richardson and Ralph Fiennes. It's a bit of a departure from the war-focused films on this list, but it's still got plenty of drama and intrigue to keep you engaged.
